data.title: Event information
data.text:
Main Stage

See below for more information about our Main Stage speakers

More about Main Stage

Nisha Anand

Nisha Anand is the CEO of Dream Corps. She is a veteran fundraiser and consultant with decades of experience in nonprofit development and management.

More about Nisha Anand

David Attenborough

Sir David Attenborough is Britain’s best-known natural history filmmaker.

More about David Attenborough

Xiye Bastida

Xiye Bastida is an 18 year-old climate justice activist and the co-founder of Re-Earth Initiative, an international youth led organisation that focuses on highlighting the intersectionality of the climate crisis.

More about Xiye Bastida

Brigitte Baptiste

Brigitte Baptiste is a biologist and public intellectual. Since 2019 she has served as Chancellor of Universidad Ean, Colombia.

More about Brigitte Baptiste

Ahmed Best

Ahmed Best is a writer, director, producer, actor, musician, host, and futurist.

More about Ahmed Best

Nobel Prize laureate

Elizabeth Blackburn

Elizabeth Blackburn is Professor Emerita in Biochemistry and Biophysics. She has been a leader in the area of telomere and telomerase research and was awarded the Nobel Prize for her work in this area.

More about Elizabeth Blackburn

Nobel Prize laureate

Martin Chalfie

Martin Chalfie, the University Professor in the Department of Biological Sciences at Columbia University, shared the chemistry prize for his introduction of green fluorescent protein (GFP) as a biological marker.

More about Martin Chalfie

Nobel Prize laureate

Steven Chu

Former United States Secretary of Energy and recipient of the Nobel Prize in Physics 1997, Steven Chu has devoted a significant part of his recent scientific career in search for new solutions to our energy and climate challenges.

More about Steven Chu

His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama

His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, describes himself as a simple Buddhist monk. He is the spiritual leader of Tibet. In 1989 he was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for his non-violent struggle for the liberation of Tibet.

More about His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama

Sandra Díaz

Sandra Díaz is a professor of ecology at Córdoba National University and a senior member of the National Research Council of Argentina.

More about Sandra Díaz

Bryan Doerries

Bryan Doerries is a New York–based writer, director, and translator who currently serves as the Artistic Director of Theater of War Productions.

More about Bryan Doerries

Peter Doherty

Peter Doherty shared the 1996 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his immunology research.

More about Peter Doherty

Jennifer Doudna

Jennifer Doudna is a biochemist at the University of California, Berkeley. Her groundbreaking development of CRISPR/Cas9 earned her the 2020 Nobel Prize in Chemistry.

More about Jennifer Doudna

Victor J. Dzau

Victor J. Dzau is President of the National Academy of Medicine, and Co-Chair of National Research Council. He is Chancellor Emeritus and Distinguished James B Duke Professor at Duke University.

More about Victor J. Dzau

Frankie Faison

Frankie Faison has been an actor of stage, screen, and television for over 40 years.

More about Frankie Faison

Anthony S. Fauci

Anthony S. Fauci is the Director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) at the U.S. National Institutes of Health, where he oversees an extensive research portfolio focused on infectious and immune-mediated diseases.

More about Anthony S. Fauci

Laurie Garrett

Author, speaker and Foreign Policy columnist Laurie Garrett founded the Anthropos Initiative, which engages at the nexus of the Anthropocene, climate change and human health.

More about Laurie Garrett

Gatwal Augustine Gatkuoth

Gatwal Augustine Gatkuoth is a South Sudanese refugee in Uganda. He is a founding member of the Upper Nile Institute of Public Health and Young Adult Empowerment Initiative.

More about Gatwal Augustine Gatkuoth

Marjolaine Goldsmith

Marjolaine Goldsmith is both an actor and Company Manager at Theater of War Productions.

More about Marjolaine Goldsmith

Al Gore

Former Vice President Al Gore is the Co-Founder and the Chair of Generation Investment Management, and the Founder and Chair of The Climate Reality Project. He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for “informing the world of the dangers posed by climate change.”

More about Al Gore

David Gross

David J. Gross is the Chancellor’s Chair Professor of Theoretical Physics at the University of California, Santa Barbara. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics “for the discovery of asymptotic freedom in the theory of the strong interaction.”

More about David Gross

Corey Hawkins

Corey Hawkins made his Broadway debut as Tybalt in the 2013 revival of 'Romeo & Juliet' and received a Tony Award nomination as Leading Actor in a Play in 2017 for his performance in 'Six Degrees of Separation'.

More about Corey Hawkins

Vidar Helgesen

Vidar Helgesen, Executive Director of the Nobel Foundation with a background as a lawyer, diplomat and politician.

More about Vidar Helgesen

Gary A. Hoover

Gary A. Hoover is the Executive Director of the Murphy Institute at Tulane University and a professor of economics. He is the founding and current editor of the Journal of Economics, Race, and Policy.

More about Gary A. Hoover

Zoë Jenkins

Zoë Jenkins is a 17-year-old education justice advocate from Lexington, KY. She is the founder and Executive Producer of Get Schooled podcast with the Kentucky Student Voice Team.

More about Zoë Jenkins

Rana el Kaliouby

A pioneer in Emotion AI, Rana el Kaliouby is Co-Founder and CEO of Affectiva, and author of 'Girl Decoded: A Scientist’s Quest to Reclaim Our Humanity by Bringing Emotional Intelligence to Technology'.

More about Rana el Kaliouby

Natalia Kanem

Natalia Kanem is the United Nations Under-Secretary-General and the Executive Director of the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), the United Nations sexual and reproductive health agency.

More about Natalia Kanem

John Kerry

John F. Kerry is the US's first Special Presidential Envoy for Climate and former United States Secretary of State.

More about John Kerry

Klaus von Klitzing

Klaus von Klitzing is the Director emeritus at the Max Planck Institute for Solid State Research in Stuttgart, Germany. He was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics for the discovery of the quantum Hall effect.

More about Klaus von Klitzing

Tamar Krishnamurti

Tamar Krishnamurti is an Assistant Professor of Medicine and Clinical and Translational Science at the University of Pittsburgh. She is the co-founder and CEO of Naima Health.

More about Tamar Krishnamurti

Simon Levin

Simon Levin is the James S. McDonnell Distinguished University Professor in Ecology and Evolutionary Biology at Princeton University. His research interests are in understanding how macroscopic patterns and processes are maintained at the level of ecosystems and the biosphere.

More about Simon Levin

James C. Liao

James C. Liao, President of Academia Sinica, Taiwan, is a member of the U.S. National Academy of Sciences, the U.S. National Academy of Engineering, and an academician of Academia Sinica.

More about James C. Liao

Thomas Lovejoy

Thomas Lovejoy is an innovative conservation biologist and Founder and the President of the nonprofit Amazon Biodiversity Center and the renowned Biological Dynamics of Forest Fragments Project.

More about Thomas Lovejoy

Christiane Maertens

Christiane Maertens is the founder of DoGoodery.

More about Christiane Maertens

Frances McDormand

Frances McDormand made her film debut in Ethan and Joel Coen’s 'Blood Simple' (1984). She received an Academy Award for her work in 'Fargo' (1996) and' Three Billboards Outside Ebbing, Missouri' (2017).

More about Frances McDormand

Marcia McNutt

Marcia McNutt is a geophysicist and the 22nd president of the National Academy of Sciences.

More about Marcia McNutt

Ahmad Mobayed

Ahmad Mobayed is a youth leader and co-founder of the Syrian Youth Assembly.

More about Ahmad Mobayed

Bill Murray

Bill Murray needs no introduction. Through his work he transcends genre, form, and many other boundaries, garnering a truly wholistic following of fans of all ages, and many accolades.

More about Bill Murray

Anne Muthoni

Anne Muthoni is a climate change enthusiast. Through her co-founded initiative, Youth Arts Mentorship Initiative, Muthoni hopes to use her acting skills to inform the Kenyan youth about climate change.

More about Anne Muthoni

Connie Nshemereirwe

Connie Nshemereirwe is an independent science and policy facilitator and acts at the science-policy interface as a science writer, trainer, and speaker.

More about Connie Nshemereirwe

David Panuelo

His Excellency David W. Panuelo is the Ninth President of the Federated States of Micronesia (FSM).

More about David Panuelo

Nobel Prize laureate

Saul Perlmutter

Saul Perlmutter shared the physics prize for the discovery of the accelerating expansion of the universe. He is a professor of physics at the University of California, Berkeley, and a senior scientist at the Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory.

More about Saul Perlmutter

Adam Riess

Adam Riess is an internationally renowned observational cosmologist working on the measurement of the expansion of the universe for which he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics.

More about Adam Riess

Richard J. Roberts

Richard J. Roberts is the Chief Scientific Officer at New England Biolabs in Ipswich, Massachusetts. He received the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his discovery of split genes.

More about Richard J. Roberts

Johan Rockström

Johan Rockström is the Director of the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research and a professor in Earth system science at the University of Potsdam. He is an internationally recognised scientist on global sustainability issues.

More about Johan Rockström

Gingger Shankar

Gingger Shankar is a composer, producer, songwriter, and the only female double violinist in the world.

More about Gingger Shankar

David Strathairn

Actor David Strathairn has appeared in many films including 'The Spiderwick Chronicles' (2008), 'The Bourne Ultimatum' (2007), Steven Spielberg’s 'Lincoln' (2012), and Chloe Zhou’s 'Nomadland' (2020).

More about David Strathairn

Harold Varmus

Harold Varmus is the Lewis Thomas University Professor of Medicine at the Meyer Cancer Center of Weill Cornell Medicine. He was awarded the Nobel Prize for his studies of the genetic basis of cancer.

More about Harold Varmus

Ursula von der Leyen

Ursula von der Leyen is the President of the European Commission.

More about Ursula von der Leyen

M. Stanley Whittingham

M. Stanley Whittingham is a SUNY Distinguished Professor of Chemistry and Materials Science and Engineering at Binghamton. He received the chemistry prize for the development of lithium-ion batteries.

More about M. Stanley Whittingham

Jumaane Williams

Jumaane Williams is New York City’s Public Advocate.

More about Jumaane Williams

Beatie Wolfe

Beatie Wolfe is an artist who has beamed her music into space, been appointed a United Nations Women role model for innovation, and held an acclaimed solo exhibition of her “world first” album designs at the Victoria & Albert Museum.

More about Beatie Wolfe

Jeffrey Wright

Jeffrey Wright has appeared in numerous films, television, and theater productions and is the co-founder and chairman, Taia, LLC and Taia Peace Foundation.

More about Jeffrey Wright

Academic Science Sessions

See below for more information about our Academic Science Session speakers

More about Academic Science Sessions

Rosina Bierbaum

Rosina Bierbaum is a professor at the University of Michigan’s School for Environment and Sustainability and the University of Maryland’s School of Public Policy. Her experience extends from climate science into foreign relations and international development.

More about Rosina Bierbaum

Eduardo S. Brondizio

Eduardo S. Brondizio is Distinguished Professor of Anthropology at Indiana University-Bloomington.

More about Eduardo S. Brondizio

Gretchen C. Daily

Gretchen C. Daily is the Co-Founder and the Faculty Director of the Stanford Natural Capital Project.

More about Gretchen C. Daily

Partha Dasgupta

Sir Partha Dasgupta is the Frank Ramsey Professor Emeritus of Economics at the University of Cambridge.

More about Partha Dasgupta

Carl Folke

Carl Folke is Director of the Beijer Institute, the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, and Founder, Science Director and Chair of the Board of the Stockholm Resilience Centre, Stockholm University, Sweden.

More about Carl Folke

Frank Geels

Frank Geels is a professor of system innovation and sustainability at the University of Manchester.

More about Frank Geels

Göran Hansson

Göran K Hansson is the Secretary General of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences and Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors of the Nobel Foundation.

More about Göran Hansson

HRH Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden

Her Royal Highness Crown Princess Victoria is the eldest child of His Majesty King Carl XVI Gustaf and Her Majesty Queen Silvia. She is the heir to the Swedish throne.

More about HRH Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden

Richard Horton

Richard Horton is the Editor-in-Chief of The Lancet.

More about Richard Horton

Karolin A. Johansson

Karolin A. Johansson is a strategic advisor at Stockholm Resilience Centre, farmer and consultant within communications and sustainability.

More about Karolin A. Johansson

Pamela Matson

Pamela Matson is an interdisciplinary sustainability scientist, academic leader, and organisational strategist. She is Dean emerita of Stanford University’s School of Earth, Energy and Environmental Sciences.

More about Pamela Matson

Hans Joachim Schellnhuber

Hans Joachim Schellnhuber is Director Emeritus of the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research.

More about Hans Joachim Schellnhuber

Brian P. Schmidt

Brian P. Schmidt is Vice-Chancellor and President of the Australian National University and 2011 Nobel Prize laureate in physics.

More about Brian P. Schmidt

Karen Seto

Karen Seto is the Frederick C. Hixon Professor of Geography and Urbanization Science at the Yale School of the Environment.

More about Karen Seto

Magdalena Skipper

Magdalena Skipper is Editor in Chief of Nature and Chief Editorial Advisor for the Nature portfolio. A geneticist by training, she holds a PhD from University of Cambridge, UK.

More about Magdalena Skipper

Joseph E. Stiglitz

Joseph E. Stiglitz is an American economist and a professor at Columbia University. He was awarded the prize in economic sciences for analyses of markets with asymmetric information.

More about Joseph E. Stiglitz

Leena Srivastava

Leena Srivastava is the Deputy Director General for Science of the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), Austria.

More about Leena Srivastava

Holden Thorp

Holden Thorp is Editor-in-Chief of the Science family of journals.

More about Holden Thorp

Solution Sessions

See below for more information about our Solution Session speakers

More about Solution Sessions

Arun Agrawal

Arun Agrawal is the Samuel Trask Dana Professor at the School for the Environment and Sustainability at the University of Michigan.

More about Arun Agrawal

Tateo Arimoto

Tateo Arimoto is a visiting professor and the Deputy Director of the Science, Technology and Innovation Policy Research Center at the National Graduate Institute for Policy Studies, the Principal Fellow at the Japan Science and Technology Agency, and the Vice Director General at the International Institute for Advanced Studies.

More about Tateo Arimoto

Svanika Balasubramanian

Svanika Balasubramanian is the Co-Founder and Chief Executive Officer of rePurpose Global, the world’s first plastic credit platform dedicated to making planetary action delightfully simple for purposeful people and companies of any size, anywhere.

More about Svanika Balasubramanian

Sajitha Bashir

Sajitha Bashir is the adviser in the Office of the Global Director of the Education Practice in the World Bank. She currently leads the work on digital skills as part of the digital economy initiatives of the World Bank.

More about Sajitha Bashir

Vinton G. Cerf

Vinton G. Cerf has served as the Vice President and the Chief Internet Evangelist for Google since October 2005. In this role, he contributes to global policy development and continued standardisation and spread of the Internet.

More about Vinton G. Cerf

Ambassador Amanda Ellis

Ambassador Amanda Ellis leads Global Partnerships for the Arizona State University (ASU) Julie Ann Wrigley Global Futures Laboratory and serves as the Co-Chair of the WE Empower United Nations (UN) Sustainable Development Goal (SDG) Challenge and the ASU SDGs and Beyond Task Force.

More about Ambassador Amanda Ellis

Julie Fratantoni

Julie Fratantoni is a cognitive neuroscientist at the Center for BrainHealth, part of the University of Texas at Dallas.

More about Julie Fratantoni

Chris Greer

Chris Greer is the Senior Executive for Cyber Physical Systems, the Director of the Smart Grid and Cyber-Physical Systems Program Office, and the National Coordinator for Smart Grid Interoperability at the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST)

More about Chris Greer

Sam Gregory

Sam Gregory is the Program Director of WITNESS, which helps people use video and technology to defend human rights.

More about Sam Gregory

Marilu Hastings

Marilu Hastings is the Chief Innovation Officer for the Cynthia and George Mitchell Foundation in Austin, Texas. Hastings originated and leads the foundation’s grantmaking program that moves knowledge to action for sustainability.

More about Marilu Hastings

Dan Higgins

Dan Higgins is the Global Technology Consulting Leader at Ernst & Young (EY) Global Ltd. and a member of its Global Consulting Executive where he is responsible for driving the business strategy and offerings for the practice.

More about Dan Higgins

Philip N. Howard

Philip N. Howard is a statutory professor of Internet studies at Balliol College at the University of Oxford.

More about Philip N. Howard

Anne Kapuscinski

Anne Kapuscinski is the Director of the Coastal Science and Policy Program and a professor of environmental studies at the University of California, Santa Cruz.

More about Anne Kapuscinski

Bobby Kia

Bobby Kia is the Co-Founder and the Head of investor relations of The Peace Department. Kia helms The Peace Department’s investment strategy and oversees its partnerships and relations with institutional investors.

More about Bobby Kia

Theresa Kotanchek

Theresa Kotanchek is the Chief Executive Officer of Evolved Analytics LLC

More about Theresa Kotanchek

Debra Lam

Debra Lam is the Founding Director of the Partnership for Inclusive Innovation,

More about Debra Lam

Katherine Maher

Katherine Maher is the Chief Executive Officer and the Executive Director of the Wikimedia Foundation and oversees the operations of the organisation and its professional staff.

More about Katherine Maher

Paola Malanotte-Rizzoli

Paola Malanotte-Rizzoli is a professor of physical oceanography in the Department of Earth, Atmospheric and Planetary Sciences at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

More about Paola Malanotte-Rizzoli

Ramesh Mashelkar

Ramesh Mashelkar is the former Director General of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research and the former President of the Indian National Science Academy.

More about Ramesh Mashelkar

Moira Mcdonald

Moira Mcdonald is the Director of the Environment Program at the Walton Family Foundation. For the past 11 years, she led the foundation’s Mississippi River and coastal initiatives.

More about Moira Mcdonald

Maria Cristina Messa

Maria Cristina Messa has been the Italian Minister of University and Research (MIUR) since February 2021.

More about Maria Cristina Messa

Sandhya Murali

Sandhya Murali is the Co-Founder and the Chief of Operations of Solstice, an award-winning social enterprise dedicated to expanding access to clean energy to all Americans.

More about Sandhya Murali

Shamila Nair-Bedouelle

Shamila Nair-Bedouelle is the Assistant Director-General for Natural Sciences at the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP).

More about Shamila Nair-Bedouelle

Safiya Noble

Safiya Noble is an Associate Professor at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) in the Department of Information Studies where she serves as the Co-Founder and the Co-Director of the UCLA Center for Critical Internet Inquiry.

More about Safiya Noble

Lyne Odhiambo

Lyne Odhiambo is part of Zero Hour, a youth-led climate and social justice organisation.

More about Lyne Odhiambo

H. E. Karin Olofsdotter

H. E. Karin Olofsdotter is the Ambassador of Sweden to the United States.

More about H. E. Karin Olofsdotter

Phoebe Omonira

Phoebe Omonira is the Director of Community Outreach for Gen Z Girl Gang.

More about Phoebe Omonira

Ilona Otto

Ilona Otto is a professor in societal impacts of climate change at the Wegener Center for Climate and Global Change at the University of Graz.

More about Ilona Otto

Carlo Ratti

Carlo Ratti is an architect and engineer by training and teaches at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, where he directs the Senseable City Lab and is a founding partner of the international design and innovation office Carlo Ratti Associati.

More about Carlo Ratti

Daya Reddy

Daya Reddy is the President of the International Science Council and holds the South African Research Chair in Computational Mechanics at the University of Cape Town, South Africa.

More about Daya Reddy

Jeffrey D. Sachs

Jeffrey D. Sachs is a professor and the Director of the Center for Sustainable Development at Columbia University, where he directed the Earth Institute from 2002 until 2016.

More about Jeffrey D. Sachs

Cristián Samper

Cristián Samper has served as the President and the Chief Executive Officer of the Wildlife Conservation Society (WCS) since 2012.

More about Cristián Samper

Kate Starbird

Kate Starbird is an Associate Professor at the Department of Human Centered Design & Engineering at the University of Washington (UW).

More about Kate Starbird

Andrew Steer

Andrew Steer is the President and the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the Bezos Earth Fund, which is a $10 billion fund that will address climate, nature, and environmental justice.

More about Andrew Steer

James Sternlicht

James Sternlicht is the Co-Founder and the President of The Peace Department.

More about James Sternlicht

Ellen Stofan

Ellen Stofan is the Under Secretary for Science and Research for the Smithsonian Institution.

More about Ellen Stofan

Sam Teicher

Sam Teicher co-founded Coral Vita, a social enterprise that grows resilient corals up to 50 times faster to restore dying reefs.

More about Sam Teicher

Armando Varricchio

Armando Varricchio is the Ambassador of Italy to the United States.

More about Armando Varricchio

Maurizio Vecchione

Maurizio Vecchione is the Co-Founder of AdAstral, the President and the Chief Executive Officer of the Washington Global Health Alliance, and the Chief Innovation Officer of the Terasaki Institute for Biomedical Innovation.

More about Maurizio Vecchione

Alfred Watkins

Alfred Watkins is the Founder and the Chairman of the Global Solutions Summit.

More about Alfred Watkins

Phil Wong

Phil Wong is the Chief Executive Officer of Misfit Foods. Wong started Misfit Foods in his college kitchen to prove that delicious foods can fight climate change.

More about Phil Wong

Ada Yonath

Ada Yonath is focusing on protein biosynthesis, antibiotics hampering it, human diseases associated with ribosomal mutations, and origin of life.

More about Ada Yonath

Webinars

See below for more information about our webinar speakers

More about Webinars

Shahzeen Attari

Shahzeen Attari is an Associate Professor at the O’Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs at Indiana University Bloomington.

More about Shahzeen Attari

Audrey Azoulay

Audrey Azoulay is Director-General of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).

More about Audrey Azoulay

Peter Bakker

Peter Bakker is the President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD).

More about Peter Bakker

Joe Robert Cole

Joe Robert Cole co-wrote the Academy Award–nominated Black Panther and is currently co-writing the sequel.

More about Joe Robert Cole

E. William Colglazier

E. William Colglazier is the Editor-in-Chief of science and diplomacy and the Senior Scholar at the Center for Science Diplomacy at the American Association for Advancement of Science (AAAS).

More about E. William Colglazier

Pedro Conceição

Pedro Conceição is Director of the Human Development Report Office and the lead author of the Human Development Report of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

More about Pedro Conceição

Jonathan Donges

Jonathan Donges is the co-leader of the FutureLab on Earth Resilience in the Anthropocene at the Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research.

More about Jonathan Donges

Cameron Hepburn

Cameron Hepburn is a professor of environmental economics at the University of Oxford and the Director of the Smith School of Enterprise and the Environment.

More about Cameron Hepburn

Tawakkol Karman

Nobel Peace Prize 2011.

Tawakkol Karman is a human rights activist, journalist and politician. She was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for her non-violent struggle for the safety of women and for women's rights to full participation in peace-building work.

More about Tawakkol Karman

Tim Lenton

Tim Lenton is the Director of the Global Systems Institute and the Chair in climate change and Earth system science at the University of Exeter.

More about Tim Lenton

Oliver Morton

Oliver Morton is a Senior Editor at The Economist.

More about Oliver Morton

Martha Delgado Peralta

Martha Delgado Peralta is an environmentalist renowned nationally and internationally, with more than 29 years of professional experience in public service through the Public Federal Administration and nongovernmental organisations.

More about Martha Delgado Peralta
